metadata.Title: CVE-2016-6480 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
Race condition in the ioctl_send_fib function indrivers/scsi/aacraid/commctrl.c in the Linux kernel through 4.7 allowslocal users to cause a denial of service (out-of-bounds access or systemcrash) by changing a certain size value, aka a "double fetch"vulnerability.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-6480` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.13.0-98-generic - 3.13.0-98.145
linux-image-3.13.0-98-generic-lpae - 3.13.0-98.145
linux-image-3.13.0-98-lowlatency - 3.13.0-98.145
linux-image-3.13.0-98-powerpc-e500 - 3.13.0-98.145
linux-image-3.13.0-98-powerpc-e500mc - 3.13.0-98.145
linux-image-3.13.0-98-powerpc-smp - 3.13.0-98.145
linux-image-3.13.0-98-powerpc64-emb - 3.13.0-98.145
linux-image-3.13.0-98-powerpc64-smp - 3.13.0-98.145
linux-image-extra-3.13.0-98-generic - 3.13.0-98.145
No subscription required

linux-image-3.19.0-71-generic - 3.19.0-71.79~14.04.1
linux-image-3.19.0-71-generic-lpae - 3.19.0-71.79~14.04.1
linux-image-3.19.0-71-lowlatency - 3.19.0-71.79~14.04.1
linux-image-3.19.0-71-powerpc-e500mc - 3.19.0-71.79~14.04.1
linux-image-3.19.0-71-powerpc-smp - 3.19.0-71.79~14.04.1
linux-image-3.19.0-71-powerpc64-emb - 3.19.0-71.79~14.04.1
linux-image-3.19.0-71-powerpc64-smp - 3.19.0-71.79~14.04.1
linux-image-extra-3.19.0-71-generic - 3.19.0-71.79~14.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-42-generic - 4.4.0-42.62~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-42-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-42.62~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-42-lowlatency - 4.4.0-42.62~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-42-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-42.62~14.04.1

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.13.0-98.145').
